Instead he prayed, and his children never missed a meal.","poster_path":"/A3pysyZgXWrWLr5IJiTa19TXDMm.jpg","media_type":"movie","adult":false,"original_language":"en","genre_ids":[99,36],"popularity":2.836,"release_date":"2006-06-06","video":false,"vote_average":7.0,"vote_count":1},{"backdrop_path":"/a9BqgCx2cdbEM1QnTNhYOBYcObx.jpg","id":598068,"title":"Ganz: How I Lost My Beetle","original_title":"Ganz: How I Lost My Beetle","overview":"Josef Ganz, editor of trade journal Motor-Kritik, amazed Germany by appearing in a revolutionary tiny car in 1932. It was his dream: a people's car anyone can afford. The idea made its way to new Reichskanzler Adolf Hitler. But in Hitler's dream there was no place for Jewish inventor Ganz. This is the story of the man whose designs led to the invention of the Volkswagen Beetle, and who ultimately lost everything.
